page.title: 16A North Shropshire Ramble
page.content: We walked along Llynclys road.Two friendly locals directed us to cross a grass field towards a large oak tree. We walked down towards a wooden gate, climbed over it onto the Llwyntidmon road.We walked along the narrow lane and passed a white farm which then led us onto a small hamlet.We then came to a small stone bridge,which led us over the Shropshire Union canal.We walked towards a crossroads and turned left towards Crickheath.We then came to a hamlet of farms the largest was Crickheath Hall,with its pedigree freisian herd.In contrast, opposite was a neat modern bungalow.We then came to East Farm which was an imposing black and white seventeeth century building.
